subject: Re: [junit] Testing a class with private constructor
msgSnippet: ... That s true, but then again: http://www-106.ibm.com/developerworks/webservices/library/co-single.html Short version: Most of the time, we /think/ it should
messageBody:
Robert Sanheim wrote:

> I'm guessing the object is a singleton or something simliar - in which
> case you would not want to make the constructor public - especially
> for the purposes of testing only.

That's true, but then again:

http://www-106.ibm.com/developerworks/webservices/library/co-single.html

Short version: Most of the time, we /think/ it should be a singleton,
but it doesn't have to be and shouldn't be.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
